alert.note: Alert for Big Stone; Traverse (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 01 at 2:58PM CST until February 01 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Blowing snow. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...In South Dakota, Marshall, Roberts and Grant Counties. In Minnesota, Traverse and Big Stone Counties. * WHEN...Until 6 PM CST this evening. * IMPACTS...Periods of blowing snow will continue to produce significantly reduced visibility at times. Strong winds could cause tree damage. The cold wind chills as low as 20 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... While not widespread, areas of blowing snow are producing visibility reduction to as low as one eighth of a mile at times on roads across northeast South Dakota and western Minnesota. Be advised. Wind speeds and gusts will be diminishing late this afternoon and evening, resulting in improved visibility and a decrease in blowing snow coverage by early this evening.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling, especially in open areas. In Minnesota, the latest road conditions can be obtained at 511mn.org, or by calling 5 1 1. In South Dakota, the latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
